column2: The Energy Transitions team seeks to hire a suitable candidate for the position of Engagement Lead to support team?? efforts on supporting states in increasing the share of distributed renewables (DRE) in the grid. A suitable candidate will require expertise on three fronts ??nudging the consumer to adopt new technologies, identifying solutions with equitable incentives for stakeholders and facilitating the process with conducive policies and regulations. This will further require the candidate to have comprehensive understanding of tariff mechanisms, state-level policies and regulations pertaining to distributed renewables, hands-on experience in stakeholder engagement (including discoms, electricity regulators, state governments and developers), profound understanding of consumer behaviour, and the power market. The candidate will be expected to travel frequently or move to a capital city in priority states and build relationship work with key stakeholders, particularly, government (both at central & state level) and industry.        Job Duties and Accountabilities       Desirable Outcomes (first year)     Expand the distributed RE programme in atleast one state and support in other states.     Build your profile and network in the state as a sector expert      Conceptualise and execute atleast one innovative idea to scale up the adoption of distributed renewable energy (DRE) in the priority state       Primary responsibilities       Conceptualise and implement new research methods, innovative ideas on market solutions, policy interventions and market design that can support the scale up of DRE technologies      Identify distributed renewable energy deployment issues and opportunities from the state?? perspective to co-conceptualise and execute research that can aid policy, regulatory and market related changes     Deepen the relationship in existing states and build relationship in new state - Respond to policy and regulatory updates, implementation of solar policy schemes, formulation of new schemes etc.     Conduct regular reviews, monitor and analyse day-to-day regulatory and policy changes in the renewable energy markets, especially on grid-connected DRE at the state, national and international level     Conduct various types of analyses using advanced data analytics tools to further the research and programme objectives      Develop trust-based relationships with key stakeholders, especially with discoms, regulators, state nodal agencies, developers and other research organisations to understand the challenges and opportunities in the DRE sector     Share knowledge and findings on various internal and external platforms based on the research and implementation efforts through presentations, memos, short reports, opinion pieces, videos, etc. with support from CEEW?? Outreach team     Publish high-quality research reports, policy papers, issue briefs, memos, opinion-pieces, blogs etc.        Programme Assistance       Lead project implementation in state by contributing towards preparing detailed activity plans and timelines, resource planning, stakeholder management, and donor engagement.      Support the team in engaging with donors on the ongoing programmes.?      Lead team?? outreach efforts including organising webinars/physical events, representing CEEW in industry events, and writing op-eds, briefs and reports.     Write memos, briefs and issue notes which could be circulated among senior Government officials and other internal and external stakeholders     Building stronger ties with government, industry and institutional partners       Qualification       Master?? degree with a specialisation in renewable energy technologies, economics, public policy or related field     Sound understanding of India?? energy markets (specifically grid-connected DRE markets) and policy and regulatory environment     Strong research background with an adequate understanding of research methods and quantitative skills       Work experience       At least 5-8 years of relevant work experience in the field of research, policy/industry engagement and project management in the area of electricity policy, electricity distribution, and renewable energy     Prior experience of writing white papers, articles, policy briefs and research reports     Strong track record of team and project management including timely delivery of outputs      Demonstrable experience in stakeholder engagement at state-level and experience of working with public and private institutions within and outside India         Key skills       Strong interpersonal and influencing skills     Proficiency in MS-Excel is a must. Understanding of STATA/R/Python and other data visualisation tools would be an added advantage     Excellent written and oral communication skills     Ability to summarise and communicate the insights/findings in written and oral formats     Proficiency in Hindi and English language
column11: SAN, Usage, Renewable energy, Project management, SOC, Engagement Lead, SMS, Research, CRM, Python

column2: As a part of the Marsh Advisory team in Knowledge Services function of MMGS, the colleague would work with our Property Risk Consulting Team in US to support Risk Engineering projects     Marsh s Property Risk Consulting Practice delivers a wide range of value-added property risk engineering and loss control identification, assessment, and mitigation consulting solutions                 What can you expect         Conduct thorough property risk assessments, developing risk management strategies, and providing recommendations to our clients     Work with property risk consultants in US to aid in report preparation and benchmarking     Being a technical expert you will guide the junior team members to enable them to capture high quality datasets from risk reports     Apart from BAU, collaborate and contribute to project based initiatives within the Data Analytics Insight team             What is in it for you         Opportunity to be a part of world s leading insurance broker and risk management company     A competitive salary, employee friendly policies, health care and insurance for you and dependents.     A respectful work environment that values healthy work-life balance.     Chance to be a part of a dynamic work culture that rewards innovation and collaboration     Future career opportunities across a global organization                 We will count on you to:         Perform on-site inspections to evaluate property and Nat Cat risks, and generate comprehensive reports to communicate findings and offer suggestions for enhancements     Analyze data, including property blueprints, inspection reports, and historical records, to identify potential risks and vulnerabilities     Develop comprehensive risk assessments and reports for clients, including risk ratings, recommendations, and risk mitigation strategies     Provide expertise and guidance on safety and security measures, fire protection, and loss prevention strategies     Stay up-to-date with industry standards, regulations, and emerging trends in property risk engineering     Communicate and engage effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, translating complex technical concepts into easily understandable terms     Train junior team members and conduct knowledge sharing sessions around complex industrial processes, hazards and risk assessment parameters     Demonstrate effective project management skills to ensure quality and timelines     Manage stakeholders with varying levels of experience and seniority.                     What you need to have:          Bachelors degree in Engineering, preferably in Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field     Around 8 years of experience in property risk engineering or a related field     Working knowledge of NFPA Codes, FM Data Sheets etc     Professional engineering license or relevant certifications (eg, PE, CFPS, CSP) is a plus     Proficiency in risk assessment methodologies, property safety standards, and relevant software tools     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team.     Strong project management skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.     Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel     Exceptional customer service focus             What makes you stand out         Experience of servicing US clients in Property Risk Engineering     Additional certifications in relevant areas, such as environmental risk assessment or disaster management, can be an advantage.     Proficiency in using software tools and technology for risk assessment and data analysis     Familiarity with relevant industry regulations and compliance standards will give you an edge
column11: Loss prevention, Data analysis, Analytical, Risk assessment, Project management, risk consulting, Engineering Manager, Customer service, microsoft, Risk management

column2: To guarantee excellence in project management across Upfields global IT portfolio, maintaining an 18-24 month (about 2 years) rolling view of demand thats budgeted, monitored, and reported on effectively. Your leadership will cultivate a culture of continuous improvement and strategic alignment within the IT project management community.                 Key Responsibilities:               Develop and sustain the overall portfolio roadmap, ensuring projects are aligned with Upfields strategic objectives and prioritised based on business impact.             Manage the portfolio pipeline to accelerate throughput of demand, optimise project delivery, considering financial and resource constraints, and ultimately accelerate delivery of portfolio value to the business.             Embed and continuously enhance project management methodologies and processes to ensure quality compliance and consistent delivery             Organise portfolio decision forums, manage change control mechanisms, and ensure the successful execution of projects.             Oversee financial tracking and reporting     ,     in collaboration with IT Finance, ensuring precision and alignment with financial systems.                   What Does It Take to Be Successful in This Role               10 years of experience in IT/Business transformation project management, with qualifications in PMI, APM, or similar.             Proven ability to deliver complex, global IT projects using both Waterfall and Agile/Scrum methods (eg SAFe).             Strong leadership skills, experience in managing a portfolio of IT programmes/projects, and a small team of PMO Analysts.             Excellent stakeholder engagement and management skills, capable of effective communication at all levels, including CxO.             A collaborative mindset focused on efficiency and the eradication of wasteful activities

column2: Bachelors Degree in Finance/Accounting, Management, Information Systems, or other relevant major or a combination of education/experience. Minimum of 5+ years Fund Administration industry experience. 3+ years Eagle experience. Minimum 3+ years of project experience collaborating with a global team. Extensive working knowledge of fund administration systems and NAV delivery process for both close and open-ended fund vehicles. Extensive technical knowledge of the treatment of complex financial instruments from an accounting standpoint. Strong client management skills and ability to build key relationships. Experience with implementing process improvement methodology and/or demonstrated experience with efficiency improvement. Experience interfacing directly with clients within Financial Markets. Experience in business process re-engineering, business systems analysis, process improvement involving broad-based information systems utilizing tools and techniques required. Must be able to learn quickly and deliver results in our dynamic environment. Must be enthusiastic, diligent, and take initiative and pride in their work. Ability to collaborate effectively with other members of the technology and operations teams, including the use of collaboration tools, source control, documentation, and bug tracking. Ability to multitask and manage multiple projects and changing priorities. Ability to work with minimal supervision within a structured environment.

Creating and executing the program related action plan     Managing a complex stakeholder landscape, where stakeholders are engaged effectively to ensure understanding, buy in and a smooth path for project delivery; engagement requirements may also include third party vendors and business services hubs. column2: The Business Transformation Senior will work with the head of the Program Enablement and Transformation Office (PETO), as it provides program management and monitors progress on our PETO capabilities. Its purpose is to provide support to our business transformation capability leaders and other stakeholders.             Individuals who thrive at Moss Adams exhibit the following success skills Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Emotional Intelligence, Executive Presence, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, and Results Focus.                 Responsibilities:                           Provide oversight to our portfolio of internal projects to ensure alignment with the firm s strategic priorities                       Partner with key project stakeholders to document content for and facilitate project deliverables                       Apply and educate others on project management approach tools, and processes to support core project management duties throughout all phases of the project life cycle and lead defined workstreams                        Provide continuous assessment and communication of work progress while identifying and surfacing potential issues and risk, manage calculation and documentation of each project s ROI                       Apply structured change methodologies that integrate with project and program management to create strategies that support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative                       Participate in developing change management plans, identifying and managing anticipated resistance to change, communications relevant to change initiatives, and defining success metrics                       Draft content for transformation communications in partnership with MA communications team                       Communicate with PETO leaders in a consistent cadence to stay closely aligned on the status of ongoing projects                       Identify opportunities for PETO delivery optimization by consistently reviewing operational processes                       Lead team/project meetings by creating agendas, facilitating conversation, and meeting objectives                       May provide guidance to PETO Specialist on workload, prioritization, and project management methodology                 Qualifications:                           Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience required; emphasis in Business or a related field preferred                       Minimum of 5 years of related experience required; experience in a professional services environment preferred                       Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to articulate complex issues to others                       Organizational and project management skills with ability to own and drive project schedules from start to finish                       Strong attention to detail, commitment to producing accurate work in a timely manner                       Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word, etc.)                       Proven commitment to providing exceptional client service                       Experience creating detailed reports and facilitating presentations and meetings                       Ability to travel as needed, approximately 5%

column2: Job Summary:? The Finance Program Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing financial projects and programs within the finance department. This role supports the CFO by coordinating cross-functional teams, driving strategic initiatives, and ensuring the successful execution of financial projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in finance, excellent project management and presentation skills, and the ability to work collaboratively across various departments. Key Responsibilities:  Project Management: Lead and manage financial projects from inception to completion, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of objectives.  Strategic Planning: Collaborate with the CFO and other senior leaders to develop and implement financial strategies and initiatives.  Cross-Functional Coordination: Work closely with various departments, including accounting, operations, and IT, to ensure alignment and successful execution of financial projects.  Performance Monitoring: Track and report on the progress of financial projects, including identifying risks and developing mitigation strategies.  Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements within the finance department and lead initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.  Stakeholder Communication: Serve as a key point of contact between the CFO?? office and other stakeholders, ensuring clear and consistent communication.  Financial Analysis: Conduct financial analysis to support decision-making and strategic planning.  Budget Management: Assist in the preparation and management of budgets for financial projects and programs.  Compliance and Reporting: Ensure that all financial projects comply with relevant regulations and reporting requirements. Qualifications: Education: MBA in Finance from a top-tier institute in India Experience: Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in finance or program management, with a proven? track record of managing complex financial projects, and working with leadership team. Relevant? industry experience (Retail lending NBFCs) preferred. Skills:  Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments.  Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.  Proficiency in financial analysis and modeling.  Experience with financial software and systems (e.g., ERP systems, financial planning tools).  Knowledge of relevant regulations and compliance requirements. Competencies:  Leadership: Ability to lead and inspire teams to achieve project goals.  Detail-Oriented: Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial analysis and reporting.  Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing priorities and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.  Strategic Thinking: Ability to think strategically and contribute to the development of long-term financial plans. This job description outlines the general nature and key responsibilities of the Finance Program Manager role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required for this position.
